availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Campbell Preston Breckinridge (Fayette County, Kentucky, lawyer, slaveholder, and colonel of 9th KY Cav (CSA))

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, lawyer. Baltimore County, Maryland, native. Son of Robert Jefferson Breckinridge and Anne Sophonisba Preston Breckinridge. Married to Lucretia "Lucy" Hart Clay Breckinridge. Father of Lee Clay Breckinridge. Married to Issa Desha Breckinridge in Fayette County, Kentucky, on September 19, 1861. Father of Eleanor "Ella" Desha Breckinridge Chalkley. Student in Fayette County in 1850. Household owned thirty-seven enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Graduate of Central College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1855. Graduate of University of Louisville Law School in Louisville in 1857. Attorney in Fayette County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Served in 9th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a colonel from July 15, 1862 to May 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 167B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Ward 3, City of Lexington, p. 456B.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0047.
